hypothesis_content.title: Options Expiry Gamma Unwind Amplification
hypothesis_content.statement: Large quarterly options expiries (>$20B notional) in NEUTRAL regime create amplified directional moves in the 4 hours post-expiry when price is within 3% of max pain at expiry, as delta hedging unwinds create liquidity voids.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes have suppressed volatility and compressed ranges. Large options positions create artificial support/resistance via dealer gamma hedging. Post-expiry, this hedging disappears, creating liquidity voids. Price moves rapidly to find new equilibrium, amplified by stop-loss cascades.
entry_conditions: BTC price within 3% of max pain at expiry time (16:00 UTC)
Volume spike (>150% of 20-day avg) in first 30min post-expiry

exit_conditions.take_profit: 4 hours after expiry OR 5% move (whichever comes first)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses through max pain level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Post-expiry 4-hour volatility < pre-expiry 4-hour volatility for >50% of large expiry events in NEUTRAL regime.
